name: Nezam Rohbani
content: Nezam Rohbani Nezam Rohbani Assistant Professor Institute for Research in Fundamental Sciences Email: rohbani AT ipm DOT ir Nezam Rohbani is an Assistant Professor and the Head of the System Group at the Institute for Research in Fundamental Sciences (IPM). He received his Ph.D. from Sharif University of Technology in 2018 and has been working at the Institute for Research in Fundamental Sciences since then. You can find my CV HERE. Students (in alphabetical order) (with Prof. Hamid Sarbazi-Azad): Kian Bahadori Roozbeh Piryadi Fatemeh Serajeh Sorush Sherafat Mohammad Arman Soleimani Research Interests: Computer Architecture: design and optimization of computer systems, including processors, memory, and interconnects. Hyperdimentional Computing: brain-inspired computing using high-dimensional vectors for efficient and robust computation, generally inside the memory. SRAM and DRAM Memory Design: design and optimization of static random-access memory (SRAM) and dynamic random-access memory (DRAM) for high-performance and low-power applications. Processing-in-Memory: integration of memory and processing capabilities to improve the performance and energy efficiency of computer systems. Neural Networks Accelerators: design and optimization of hardware accelerators for neural network computations. Fault Management in Neural Networks: techniques for detecting and mitigating faults in neural network computations. Non-Volatile Memories: design and optimization of non-volatile memory technologies, such as flash and phase-change memory, for high-performance and low-power applications. Aging-Aware Processor Architecture Design: design and optimization of computer systems that are aware of aging effects and can adapt to them. Thermal and Power Management: design and optimization of thermal and power management techniques for computer systems. Aging and Process Variation Sensors: design and optimization of sensors for monitoring aging and process variation in computer systems.
